name: G Structured Data
author: Sinan Yorulmaz

sections.description:
G Structured Data (GSD) is a simple and convenient WordPress plug-in developed to help Google understand the content of your site and enable custom search result features for your pages.

1.1.6

  • Components updated.
  • Bugs fixed.

1.1.5

  • Added contact card feature.
  • Bugs fixed.

1.1.4

  • Errors in tags added to category have been fixed.

1.1.3

  • Fixed some bugs in components.

1.1.2

  • Fixed errors in the label insertion.

1.1.1

  • Bugs fixed.

1.1

  • Site added the capability to add tracking code.
  • Tag insert feature updated.
  • Bugs fixed.

1.0.5

  • Keyword support for the “All in One SEO Pack” plugin was introduced.

1.0.4

  • Edits have been made to the language files.

1.0.3

  • Added component support for tags.
  • Fixed bugs in mobile view of Tags feature.
  • The general icon of the plugin has been changed.
  • Added a special on-off feature for tags.

1.0.2

  • Edits have been made to show added tags on the site.

1.0.1

  • Some of the problems with URL structure of the plug-in has been fixed.
sections.installation:
Automatic Installation

Once you have entered the WordPress panel, you can automatically install the plugin by searching for “G Structured Data” in the “Install Add-ons” page.

Manual Installation

  1. Load the “g-structured-data” folder in the ZIP file you downloaded into the “wp-content/plugins” folder in the directory of your WordPress installation.
  2. From your WordPress panel, go to the “Plugins” page and activate the “G Structured Data” plugin.

It’s that easy! Now when you enter the edit page of any of your content, you can see the “G Structured Data” box at the bottom of your page.
sections.faq:
Is there a setting panel?

Yes there is.

Do you add any files to the web page? (CSS, JS etc)

No, only the structured data codes provided by Google are added. If you have turned on the hashtags feature, a metadata is also added.

I do not see GSD plugin under some content?

This is normal, as there may be different “Post Types” depending on the theme you are using. If you add these Post Types by entering the GSD plugin’s settings panel, the plugin box will appear.
